Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about Maria Skibniewska's translation of Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" and the history of the Polish edition from 1961-1963.

## Maria Skibniewska - The Translator

Maria Skibniewska (born May 3, 1904 in Warsaw, died October 28, 1984) was a translator of English and French literature, including works by J.R.R. Tolkien. She was a Polish translator primarily of English and French literature who translated approximately one hundred books into Polish.

## The Polish Edition of "The Lord of the Rings" (1961-1963)

The first Polish translation of "The Lord of the Rings" was published in three volumes between 1961-1963 by Czytelnik publishing house. The three volumes translated by Skibniewska were published in 1961, 1962, and 1963, with most poems not translated by her but by Włodzimierz Lewik (volumes I–II) and Andrzej Nowicki (volume III).

This was the third translation of Tolkien's work into a foreign language, following Dutch and Swedish. The first Polish translation was the third translation into a foreign language after Dutch and Swedish, and to this day it is considered the best of the available translations.

## Consultation with Tolkien

In working on the translation of "The Lord of the Rings," she consulted with Tolkien. She signed the contract for the translation with Czytelnik in 1958, and in June 1959, she wrote a letter to Allen & Unwin asking for guidance to assist her with the translation, which was forwarded to Tolkien.

Her translation of "The Lord of the Rings" is considered the best, and it was recommended to Tolkien himself by Przemysław Mroczkowski.

## Innovation in Polish Language

During her work on translating "The Lord of the Rings," she introduced the word "krasnolud" (dwarf) into Polish and the variant "elfowie" instead of "elfy" for elves.

## Legacy and Recognition

Skibniewska's translation of "The Lord of the Rings" is considered excellent or even nearly congruent, capturing Tolkien's elevated tone while maintaining his fluent style, making it very readable. Her translation is usually considered "canonical" and was the basis for the Polish translation of Peter Jackson's "The Lord of the Rings" films.

Skibniewska translated about one hundred books, including works by various authors, and among Tolkien's works, she translated "The Hobbit" (first published in 1960 by Iskry), followed by "The Lord of the Rings," and later worked on "The Silmarillion."
